meanings.definition: Avoided by moving quickly out of the way.
meanings.sent1: She dodged the ball coming towards her.
meanings.sent2: The cat dodged the falling vase.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dodged the acorn like a tiny ninja.
meanings.sent4: He dodged the raindrops as if they were bullets.
meanings.sent5: The child dodged the oncoming bicycle with a quick sidestep.

meanings.sent1: The spy dodged the security guards and escaped.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit dodged the fox chasing it.
meanings.sent3: The student dodged the pop quiz by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent4: She dodged the awkward conversation by pretending to get a phone call.
meanings.sent5: The criminal dodged the police by hiding in the abandoned building.

meanings.definition: To avoid answering or dealing with something.
meanings.sent1: He dodged the question about his grades.
meanings.sent2: She dodged the issue by changing the topic.
meanings.sent3: The politician dodged the tough questions with rehearsed answers.
meanings.sent4: They dodged the responsibility by blaming each other.
meanings.sent5: The employee dodged the meeting by pretending to be busy.
